condition.narrative: Appointment of the Independent Verification Agent (s) (IVA) as per Section I, Paragraph C.1.(a) of Schedule 2 of the Loan Agreement
Implementing entities as per Section I, Paragraph A.2.(b) of Schedule 2 of the Loan Agreement

The Borrower, through MOETE, shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Project Operations Manualcontaining detailed arrangements and procedures for: (a) the composition and roles and responsibilities of the PSC; (b)institutional coordination and day-to-day execution of the Project as well as the roles and obligations of the ImplementingAgencies; (c) monitoring, evaluation, reporting and communication; (d) eligibility criteria, detailed rules and procedures foridentification, registration and selection of selected schools and public places, (e) administration, financial management,procurement and accounting; (f) the Verification Protocol and the appointment of a Verification Agent; and (g) suchother administrative, technical and organizational arrangements and procedures as shall be required for purposes of implementationof the Project.

The Borrower, through MOETE, shall establish prior to Project implementation, and thereafter maintain throughout suchimplementation, a Project Coordination Unit, with adequate staff, with terms and reference acceptable to the Bank. To this end, theProject Coordination Unit shall be responsible for the technical oversight and implementation of the Project to ensure that theProject meets all of its objectives, including: (i) the overall management, coordination, reporting, monitoring, and evaluation ofProject implementation; (ii) fiduciary aspects of implementation, including financial management and procurement; (iii) providingtechnical support to the Project Steering Committee; and (iv) hiring and interfacing with the Verification Agent.

title.narrative: Percentage of female KG1-2 and grades 1-6 public teachers demonstrating effective improved teaching practices
1. Increased percentage of Kindergartens (KG) that reach higher quality standards according to the Quality Assurance (QA) System
Grievances resolved within the stipulated service standards for response times
Percentage of female teachers with access to digital and TV educational learning resources quarterly
2. First cohort of students graduates from secondary education under the new tablet-based school leaving examination

target.value: First cohort of students graduates from secondary education under the new tablet-based assessment and certification system

actual.value: The First grade 12 cohort (under the reform, enrolled in grade 10 in 2018/2019) sat for a paper-based examinations ending earlyAugust 2021. The test was driven by new item-test banks (higher order thinking skills) and marked using new grading software. TheMinistry of Education focused more on the higher order thinking skills test items and will resubmit the draft education lawamendment to the Parliament shortly.Plans for test administration for 2021/2022 will be announced by the Minister in March 2022.

title.narrative: Digital and TV Educational Channels learning resources accessed

target.value: 50% of targeted students, teachers have access to digital and TV educational learning resources by grades/subject

actual.value: Digital and TV educational Learning Resources extended to grades 4-12; yet to be verified by third-part independent verificationagent.

target.value: Education Technology entity fully operational: (a) adequately staffed; (b) sufficiently funded; (c) actively monitor and report onimplementation; and (d) produce annual operational plans

title.narrative: Grade 7 new national test designed, developed and administered

target.value: New grade 7 national assessment successfully administered

title.narrative: National Education Decision Support System operational

target.value: The Education Decision Support System developed and informed by: Content usage data; professional development data; Studentassessment data; and EMIS

title.narrative: Diagnostic study of KG teaching practices

actual.value: KG Diagnostics Data collection completed in December 2021. Results presented to MOETE officials in January 2022.

title.narrative: Tablet-based assessment management and delivery platform

target.value: Functional Platform:a.platform designed, tested and deployedb.data transfer, management, analysis and reporting platform forindividual assessment results developed and deployed

actual.value: More than 25,000 teachers and school administrators qualified to create an item bank, manage the administration and marking thetests, and make the grade 10, 11 and 12 scores available electronically to students, directorates, districts, and school principalsin less than a month.

target.value: NCEEE functions as the national center for tests and examinations

actual.value: NCEEE restructuring plan finalized and approved by the Minister MOETE.

title.narrative: Tablet-based Grade 10, 11 and 12 tests in eight subjects designed, developed and administered

target.value: Increased public confidence in the school leaving examination system

actual.value: Over 1.2 million students in grades 10 and 11 sat for multi-disciplinary tests designed and developed using item-test bank andadministered nationwide in April 2021.Grade 12 students (700,000 students nationwide) sat for a new paper-based (higher orderthinking skills) test in July 2021; neither tablet-based not subject to cumulative GPA score for grades 10,11, and 12.

title.narrative: Developed and implemented Continuous Professional Development (CPD) framework for Grades 1-12 Teachers and supervisors

target.value: New CPD Framework used to guide development of teacher training modules in grades 1-6

actual.value: The CPF framework for teachers in grades 1-6 was drafted and to be finalised in April 2022.

title.narrative: Grade 4 sample-based national assessment test designed, developed and administered

actual.value: The grade 4 assessment framework finalized and approved. The baselines administration completed in December 2021 and resultsexpected by June 2022.

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
3. Percentage of KG1-2 and grades 1-6 teachers of public schools demonstrating effective teaching practice
Percentage of In-service KG teachers receiving additional training driven by diagnostic study
Lessons learned from reform implementation disseminated

target.value: Lessons learned from reform implementation disseminated

title.narrative: Percentage of supervisors are trained using the new training modules

target.value: 35 % of grades 1-6 supervisors are trained using the new training modules driven by CPD framework and standards

title.narrative: Percentage of female students with access to digital and TV educational learning resources quarterly

target.value: 50% of students with access to digital and TV educational learning resources are females

title.narrative: Percentage of grades 1-6 teachers are trained using the new training modules

baseline.value: New CPD framework to guide training modules still being developed

target.value: 35 % of grades 1-6 teachers are trained using the new training modules driven by CPD framework and standards

actual.value: New CPD framework to guide training modules expected to be finalized and approved by April 2022

title.narrative: Percentage of principals, vice-principals and district heads demonstrating effective performance

baseline.value: Performance-based evaluation system not developed yet

target.value: 25% of School Principals, Vice Principals and District heads demonstrate effective performance, as assessed by new performancebased evaluation

actual.value: Delays in drafting of the CPD framework to guide the development of the monitoring tools.

title.narrative: Public perceptions to education sector reforms
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
Data provided through the Education Decision Support System are disaggregated by gender
Gender sensitive behavior and Climate awareness training are included in Supervisors training modules
Gender sensitive behavior and Climate awareness training are included in teacher training modules
